title: Login button attention pulse and ProfileSetupModal enter/exit animations

requirements.summary: Add a subtle looping brightness pulse to the Login button only when unauthenticated and not currently logging in.
acceptanceCriteria: When identity is not present (unauthenticated), the Login button visibly but subtly pulses/brightens in a smooth loop.
When loginStatus is "logging-in", the attention animation is disabled and the button does not pulse.
When identity becomes present (authenticated), the Login button is replaced by the authenticated user menu (existing behavior) and no login attention animation is shown anywhere.

file_operations.description: Add a custom Tailwind keyframes+animation entry for a gentle looping attention pulse (brightness/opacity/glow) that can be applied via a utility class (e.g., used with motion-safe).

Apply the new attention pulse animation class to the Login button only when not disabled (i.e., loginStatus is not "logging-in"); ensure it remains inactive during "Logging in...". Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add smooth fade+slide entrance and exit animations to ProfileSetupModal DialogContent without changing modal behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: When ProfileSetupModal transitions from closed to open (open={true}), the DialogContent animates in with a combined fade + slight slide (direction can be up or down).
When ProfileSetupModal transitions from open to closed (open={false}), the DialogContent animates out with a combined fade + slight slide, with no abrupt unmount/visual pop.
No changes to the modalâ€™s functional behavior: it remains non-dismissable via outside click/escape as currently implemented, and continues to open/close based on existing setup gating logic.

file_operations.description: Update DialogContent className to use state-based animation utility classes (e.g., data-[state=open]/data-[state=closed]) to fade+slide in on open and fade+slide out on close, keeping existing non-dismissable behavior intact. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
